Name: Masters of The Universe: Fields of Eternia The Board Game – She-Ra on Swiftwind
Description:
For the Honour of Grayskull. Take flight with She-Ra and her noble steed, Swiftwind.

Package contains:

1x She-Ra and Swiftwind limited miniature with scenic base integrated
1x game card

No glue required to assemble.
Item is available in Europe only.
Families: Game: Masters of the Universe – Fields of Eternia

Name: Catacombs Cubes: Bothaar Brickworks & Forge of Gnoth
Description:
2 new Village Structure Tiles:

Bothaar Brickworks (Level 1): Requires 8 blocks to complete and generates 3 points

Forge of Gnoth (Level 2): Requires 10 blocks to complete and generates 5 points

 - Originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple  Kickstarter campaign -

Name: Departo 44: Devenez le meilleur guide de Loire-Atlantique
Description:
Departo 44: Devenez le meilleur guide de Loire-Atlantique lets you become the best guide in the "Loire-Atlantique" department through questions about history, geography, culture...

Gameplay:

     Take a coach trip through the Loire-Atlantique department and answer questions,
     For every correct answer a passenger gets in the bus,
     Collect 9 "Stage" cards,
     Once the bus is full of tourists and the 9 "Stage" cards are gathered, the player-guide must go back to its start
     The winner is the first guide to be back


Contents:

     1 game board
     500 question cards
     36 Stages cards
     4 wooden coaches with 6 passenger spaces.
     24 pins representing the passengers.
     1 wooden dice
     1 ruleset

Name: Catacombs: "Tylor" Zombie Promo
Description: A new Level 1 Monster Card, originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple  Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Departo 49: Devenez le meilleur guide du Maine-et-Loire
Description:
Departo 30: Devenez le meilleur guide du Maine-et-Loire lets you become the best guide in the "Maine-et-Loire" department through questions about history, geography, culture...

Gameplay:

     Take a coach trip through the Maine-et-Loire department and answer questions,
     For every correct answer a passenger gets in the bus,
     Collect 9 "Stage" cards,
     Once the bus is full of tourists and the 9 "Stage" cards are gathered, the player-guide must go back to its start
     The winner is the first guide to be back


Contents:

     1 game board
     500 question cards
     36 Stages cards
     4 wooden coaches with 6 passenger spaces.
     24 pins representing the passengers.
     1 wooden dice
     1 ruleset

Name: Cindr: Drakkenstrike & Paralyssx Promo Card
Description:
A new Cindr App Dragon Profile card:  "We may be twins, but we're anything but identical.  One quick to act, the other analyzes every move. Together, we are nigh unbeatable. Are you game?"

Text says:
When dating the twins... Roll two dice for each attribute for a total of 8 dice. Center attributes give two Blue dice. Edge attributes give a Red and a Green die.
When burned, lose 3 Love points.

Originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple  Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Conflicting Legends: Ferdinand Magellan Promo Card
Description:
Ferdinand Magellan:  If you have a RED and BLUE Persona in front of you, gain the top card of the Realm deck (Culture/Green)

Originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple  Kickstarter campaign

Name: ガブル レモネード（Gaburu Lemonade)
Description: Gaburu: Lemonade is a competitive two-player card game in which players use their cards to vie for food markers. A battle occurs when both players have placed three cards in the same row. Players total the values of their cards in that row, and the player with the highest total claims that row's food marker. The player who claims the most food markers, or who manages to break their opponent's egg, wins the game.

Name: Ronchonchon
Description:
The atmosphere is not good in the house: one of your roommates has a problem. For everything to be in order we will have to cooperate to listen to him and find solutions with him. And this, before Spleen, the incarnation of dark ideas, enters, otherwise it is the guaranteed mess!

Ronchonchon is a role-playing and memory game about emotions and the needs that meet them.
6 characters and 24 scenarios will allow players to imagine a feeling in relation to a given situation. Ronchonchon allows you to get to know each other better, to understand each other better and to develop your attention towards others.

Players must move around the house to find pairs of chips as the story unfolds and before the Spleen figurine passes through the front door.

     Move your roommate into the house,
     Find two identical chips,
     Reassure Roommate Ronchonchon before Spleen enters in the house.

Name: The Suits: Cthulhu
Description:
Medieval knights clashed to prove their bravery, courage and to impress rich and (sometimes) beautiful women. The Middle Ages are a relict of the past, but men are still men afterall and they still want to prove their superiority. So, what is the most reliable and effective way to distinguish a nobleman from a peasant? Oh yes! Duel! Instead of wearing full plate armor they wear equally charming elegant suits. Instead of fighting on the tournament arena, they meet in the underground of secret club called The Suits. Join this elite society and fight for your prestige and ...........*


    ) Enter your deepest and darkest desire that you want to fight for (or die for, but it wasn't in the agreement)


And remember that the first and last rule of The Suits Club is - you do not talk about The Suits Club.

This season is different. Why? Because this time female characters are entering to the club.

This is the 5th season of the Suits. This time memmers of the club will face dark cultist, creatures from the deepest nightmares and Cthulhu himself. For the first time players will have option to play multiplayer game. Three against one. In the box players will find three new characters that can be mixed with those from other seasons and Ancients Ones from the H.P. Lovecraft's novels.

Each character has his own unique deck of cards. By using your wits, tactics, strategies and of course, a little bit of luck you can show your enemies who is the real gentleman. The Suits is a fast-paced, two-person card game steaming with atmosphere and tactical depth.

Name: The Battle of Bunker Hill: June 17th 1775
Description:
This is a battle that has fascinated players over the years and this game is a real challenge for them. It shows the bravery and doggedness of the British against the abilities of the fledgling Americans Rebels. In their leaders, Howe must attempt to overwhelm the enemy, while Prescott had to organise a defence against them out of nothing. To achieve this, we have written a set of rules to showpiece the distinctive way this battle was fought.
 Each side has a unique set of circumstances and using miniature forces on hexes, manoeuvreing, dice rolls, fire and melee the players must face the problems the leaders of the actual battle had to overcome. In this particular case, the Regular British Line must overpower the semi trained Revolutionary Militia of 1775 in their defensive terrain.
 The core of the game is aimed at the players, this means that all players should be involved throughout the game. Not having to wait until one player has finished all their moves and firing. The action should be continuous for all players. Just because you have the best soldiers you should not automatically win. The game should be enjoyable and everyone should have a chance to win.

A set of rules that showpieces the distinctive way this battle was fought and highlights the bravery and doggedness of the British against the emerging abilities of the fledgling American Rebels. Lead the American Militia to defend the works on Breeds Hill or send your doughty British Regulars into attack again and again! The fate of a nation is your hands, its your choice.

Game Inventory:
Orders of Battle
Playsheet
10.5" x 7.5" Map
Battle Briefing
11 page rules booklet

Printed and downloadable versions available.

-description from publisher's website

Name: The Battle of Cropredy Bridge: June 29th 1644
Description:
This is a classic English Civil War battle with the Parliamentarians trying to seize an opportunity by catching the Royalist army on the march towards Oxford. Led by the King the Royalist army responded quickly with the ensuing battle playing out over a large area, in three phases and with a similar amount of Horse and Foot.

Presented as a “mini-campaign” using a multiple boards approach used in the original Little Bighorn game.

Cavalry charges, infantry stands and desperate defences are hallmarks of this battle.

Game Inventory:
Orders of Battle
Playsheet
10.5” x 7.5” map
Battle Briefing
11 page rules booklet

Printed and downloadable versions available.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Fire and Move: Armour
Description:
Fire and Move is a game about “tanks” – it’s that simple. It’s fun to play and easy to set up with uncomplicated systems. This game is fast and involves everyone.

To us, Rules for Playing Battles are aimed at players, this means that all players should be involved throughout the game. The action should be continuous for all players and everyone should have the chance to win. Just because you have the best tank, with the best armour and a bigger gun, you shouldn’t automatically win.

We chose to focus on the things that can happen quickly in combat and by speeding these elements up we moved the game along at pace. The concept for this game is to play the game in quite small areas (12 x 12 hexes) and be quick to play.

It is about Troops and Platoons of tanks working together in games with Companies and Platoons, Squadrons or Troops.

Game Inventory:
Map Notes
Tank Table
Playsheet
Scenario 
16 page rules booklet

Printed and downloadable versions available.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Blarney Stones
Description:
Blarney Stones is a betting game.  The board has 10 spaces with a 3 letter word on each.  The words all begin with P, end with either T or N, and have vowels as middle letters.  3 D6 letter dice are thrown to make one of the words on the board.  One die has all Ps, but includes a different number on each face.  The second has either an N or a T.  The third has the five vowels and a blank.  Before the dice are thrown, players bet on which word will come up.  They may bet multiple chips on one word or more.  (The chips are all one color, so players need to note how many they played on each word.) The dice thrower is the banker who does not bet.  The banker pays the winner(s) the chips they bet multiplied by the number showing on the P die, but collects the chips from the non-winning spaces.  Should a blank be thrown on the vowel die, the banker pays all players, but only chip for chip.  When this occurs, the banker position rotates to the player on the left.

Interestingly, no win condition is stated, though one, such as last man standing, can easily be made up.

Name: Frontier Valley
Description:
In Frontier Valley you will hire workers, learn about their abilities and employ them as farmers to produce goods on your land, as craftsmen to make the building material you buy with your produce and as townsfolk to make use of your new facilities. You will need to make sure to make good use of the land so you are the player to better satisfy the market's demands. But beware: one misjugded applicant, one thoughtless land lease or one greedy building project could be all that is needed for the luck to turn towards your opponent!

Frontier Valley is a two-player 18 card game of deduction, market manipulation, building structures and powerful one-time actions. Each round you choose one worker card from your hand to use. This might sound easy, but as in Hanabi, you do not see your own cards, only the ones of your opponent, so make sure you make the right pick even when you do not have perfect information! You then use this worker as farmer to plant new crops and thus changing the price of produce on the market, as builder to erect new structures (if you can sell valuable goods) that bring victory points or as townsfolk to use powerful one-time actions on your already standing buildings. Then you will have to give your opponent some hints of her choosing toward the cards in her hand. Will you manage to outsmart your opponent by manipulating the supply of farming goods such that you always have the most valuable produce? Will you be able to hire a sought after seasoned architect to build the most impressive town buildings? Whoever has the buildings with the most victory points in total will be the winner of Frontier Valley.

The game features a beginner mode for learning the interactions of hints, the type of workers there are and the market dynamics. Once you played this at least once, feel free to add the one-time actions of townsfolk to the game for added complexity and challenge.

-description from designer

Name: Clear the Dungeon
Description: Clear the Dungeon is a solitaire card game played with a standard 52 card French deck.  The goal of the game is to successfully remove the monsters (face cards) from the dungeon (tableau).  This is done by building up an attack on the tableau with cards from the draw pile and triggering it with a card that matches in suit.

Name: Crash Factor
Description:
Crash Factor is a truly strategic pure balancing game played with calibrated weights.
Players take turns in a race to be rid of their "fleet" of varied weights by playing them onto a balancing gameboard into risk-reward zones.
Causing a crash or being unable to make a play during the game adds a dangerous penalty piece to the fleet.
A concentric "Crash Factor" grid allows players to anticipate the crash risk of any weight placed anywhere.
Playing risky moves away from the center of balance can win advantages or eliminate penalties.

GAMEPLAY BASICS:
A win is triggered once a player has deployed all their spaceships and space junk.

- Flip over a "mission" card to reveal a value.
- You must match that value with the weight value of any quantity of spaceships deployed anywhere onto the solar system.
- The farther from the center a ship is deployed, the greater the risk and greater the reward.
- You may "dock" (stack) them onto any other spaceship to have their values added together towards making the required match.
- Get a space junk penalty piece if unable to make a match or by causing a crash.
- After a crash, the empty solar system gets re-balanced to continue the game.
- Get rid of your space junk or risk being eliminated by getting a 2nd one.
- Strategically manage the deployment of your light and heavy ships as your fleet diminishes while the game advances.
- Look for or create opportunities to deploy into high risk zones to gain significant advantages or eliminate a penalty.
- Tactically play special utility devices anytime during a mission.
- Ruthlessly capture an opponent's resources by docking onto their spaceship.
- You can choose one of three play options instead of choosing a mission:
1) Jettison a piece of space junk.
2) Take back a needed spaceship.
3) Swap an un-deployed heavy ship for its equivalent weight from your lighter ships that have been deployed.

Play at your own risk!

Name: D6: New Hero Promo Cards
Description:
2 new Hero cards. Text on both cards read:
Natural d4

Originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple Kickstarter campaign

Name: SINS: Spawn of Minions – Trilogy Box
Description:
SINS is a deck-destructor and a highly competitive game. It’s built from the core to be an aggressive game of powers and weaknesses. Both attacking and defending will cost you deeply and exhaust your hand. Therefore, be careful not to be too aggressive or too defensive, as you might lose your advantage. 
Pick your battles, save your strength, take the hit and fight back when your opponent is exhausted.
Each battle pack of cards has a specific sin and each sin has a unique set of principles, which can either form or change your strategy as you play through the game.

SINS: Spawn of Minions introduces 3 different themed battle packs focus around the sins of envy, sloth and lust which supports 2-6 players.

Name: The Sherlock Files: Vol IV – Fatal Frontiers
Description:
Are you a modern mastermind detective?

The Sherlock Files: Final Frontiers includes three new confounding cases for you to solve - all taking place in Tornado Town, a place full of quarrels, cowboys, and cahoots.

First, you will delve into the sordid history of a mine rumored to be cursed. Next, you will unearth the truth of who has been desecrating graves in the Tornado Town cemetery. Finally, you will investigate a fatal duel that killed both participants at sunrise.

Decipher clues to determine which are relevant to the case and which are not. Share what you deem relevant with your detective partners. Which theories will you chase?

How will you fare compared to the world’s greatest detective? Work together to solve each case and find out!

Name: The Adventure Zone: Bureau of Balance Game – Reclaimer Rewards Bonus Pack
Description:
The Reclaimer Rewards bonus pack is a mini expansion that came with each copy of the game if you were part of the advanced preorder (Dec 2019- Jan 2020) 
It includes:
The Rogues Gallery Mission Card + 10 Challenge Cards
6 unique Fantasy Kostco Cards
3 Surprise Cards including Clint McElroy, G'Naash, and NO-3113

Name: Counting Campers
Description:
Counting Campers is the fun counting game for your little camper. Players move their pegs forward or backward along the hiking trail by drawing a ‘plus’ or ‘minus’ card. Follow the winding path through the muddy swamp, across the fishing pond, over the old bridge, and more, to get back to the campsite. The first ‘camper’ back to camp wins the game!

In more detail, each player chooses a Camper and places it in the starting space on the game board in its matching color trail. Shuffle the cards and place them to the side of the board, facedown. Let the camping trip begin!

On your turn, draw a card from the playing deck. If a plus card (+) is drawn, jump your Camper forward the number shown. If a minus (-) card is drawn, move backwards the number shown. It's a great way for young players to practice counting skills and learn the concept of plus (+) and minus (-) while having fun!

Watch for special Camper cards while you play! If a card is drawn with a happy Camper with a sun/rainbow, draw two more cards and move. If a card is drawn with an unhappy Camper under a rain cloud, you lose a turn.

The first Camper to reach the campsite wins! For additional challenge for older players, the exact number card must be drawn in order to move the remaining spaces to the finish.

Name: BattleTech: Battle of Tukayyid
Description:
On 1 May 3052, over twenty Galaxies from seven Clans clashed with twelve Armies of Comstar's Com Guards. For twenty-one days, one of the largest campaigns in BattleMech warfare unfolded to decide the fate of the Inner Sphere.

The Battle of Tukayyid brings players back to this gargantuan conflict, allowing them to relive one of BattleTech's most pivotal moments. It builds off of the Chaos Campaign: Succession Wars framework to unleash a massive experience players will enjoy across dozens of games. Each of the seven campaigns within includes the following: a short fiction entry and write-up of the battle, including a map of the regions; the specific Combatants involved, along with insignia; and details to allow players to play out each campaign on their tabletop. Finally, a technical readout section showcases 'Mech variants that first appeared during this conflict.

This Chaos Campaign puts you as the hero -- Aidan Pryde, Anastatius Focht, and others -- of the battle. Do you have what it takes to lead the Smoke Jaguars to victory, or will you repeat the failure of the Diamond Sharks? Or can you find a way to defeat the indomitable Clan Wolf? You will decide.

For use with: Clan Invasion box set, MapPack: Battle of Tukayyid, and compatible with Total Warfare and Alpha Strike.

-description from publisher's website

Name: King's Eye
Description:
You have languished for what feels like an eternity in the prison of an unjust king, but today your sentence has been adjusted to fit his fancy. He has demanded your participation in a grueling set of trials against the foulest creatures in the kingdom. The deal is simple: Survive the test and the king will grant your freedom. In order to maximize the king's enjoyment, you will not be alone and you will be allowed time to prepare.

King's Eye is a cooperative, drafting battle simulator for 2-4 players. Choose a character, draft a deck full of upgrades and equipment, and battle through 7 waves of mobs.

King's Eye is played in 2 major phases. In phase 1, players draft upgrade decks in a traditional pass drafting format using 3 "packs" of 9 cards per player from the 120 included upgrade cards. These cards improve character stats and add new abilities/actions that players will be able to utilize in phase 2. At the end of the draft, players have a 27 card deck full of exciting enhancements with which to power-up their character.

Phase 2 is a cooperative battle through 7 waves of mobs. Each round a number of mobs equal to the number of players joins the battle, players take their turns, and then any remaining mobs take their turns. The 7 waves are split into 3 waves each of basic and intermediate mobs, followed by a boss mob wave at the end. Throughout the wave battle, players are becoming stronger and stronger as they seek to stay alive and dispatch the enemies. Once the boss mobs arrive, players have 3 rounds to clear all enemies. Any player that is still alive after all of the enemies have been defeated shares the victory, earning their freedom and the joy that comes from seeing the shock in the King's Eye.

On your turn, you draw a card from your upgrade deck and choose a card in your hand to play. Then you can choose 2 actions to perform from you list of available actions.  Everyone has certain action options: draw a card, play a card, perform a basic attack. Each character, and many upgrade cards offer additional action options for players to utilize.

Name: NewSpeak: Deluxe Edition
Description:
NewSpeak is a tense game of dystopian subversion in which you take the role of either the 'dissidents' or the 'moderators' in a mind-bending battle of wits to determine the reality around you.

Will you challenge the status quo and shatter your fragile reality or seek to protect the safety of what you know?

Dissidents utilise matching underground codes to coordinate meetings at one of the disturbingly illustrated locations on your map. They then each secretly use their location dials to declare their intended meeting point.

The Mods, in a short amount of time, then have to determine where they expect the Dissidents to meet by inferring their intent from a book of every possible code set the subversives could use, and agree upon a location to direct a state raiding party.

Once they've agreed on a location, the Dissidents each reveal their location dials. Depending on whether the majority of Dissidents have successfully coordinated at a single location, or the Mods have caught them in an attempt at subversion will determine whether that location becomes 'hacked' or 'moderated'.

As the game progresses, moderated locations produce potential accomplices for the Dissidents to recruit, as undesirables are driven from now sanitized districts. However, as the Dissidents progress their mission to 'hack' as many locations as possible, the Moderators strike back with increasing numbers of surveillance outposts, installed to limit the Dissident's ability to move around the city undetected.

NewSpeak: Deluxe Edition includes the NewSpeak base game and two expansions - Rated and Sabotage - all packaged inside one box.

Name: Deranged: Monstrumologist & Expurgation Promo Cards
Description:
2 new Promo cards:

1 new Role card (Monstrumologist): "Defeat a Deranged.  Reward: Expurgation"

1 new Reward card (Expurgation): "Spend 3 [Health value] and discard a Deranged Token from any Character."

Originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple Season 3 Kickstarter campaign

Name: Drop Bears: Survival Series, Chapter 1
Description:
The Australian Bush is a dangerous place at night. And as if spiders and snakes weren't enough, another horror is on the loose: Drop Bears infest the dark - Hideous koala-like beasts dropping from gum trees, eager to consume human flesh. This is where the game drops you in, an inexperienced group of tourist campers ventured into the night. Your objective: Survive until dawn.

Drop Bears is a cooperative game where the Campers have to carefully choose actions every turn to stay alive, while the whole Australian Bush is on a hunt for them. The group can choose of several different options to ensure as many campers as possible survive until dawn. While doing so, the game drops the hideous creatures right on them, attacking and terrorizing the Campers in every turn. Even the very landscape and environment will batter the poor Campers – They can become severely wounded; this will surely hamper their chance for survival.

Each time a camper is eaten, that player will select another camper from those available, but every death brings the Drop Bears closer to victory, so don't let your humans die in vain. With no weapons, campers must band together, scavenge gear and use their wits if they ever hope to survive.

-description from designer

Name: Candidate
Description:
Candidate is a two-player loosely-themed abstract game played on a 5 x 5 grid.  Each player has a set of the same 5 pieces in their own color.  There are 3 types of pieces; 1 candidate, 2 party, 2 media.  These pieces are square, with numbers along each edge.  The game begins with each player's set against that player's side of the board with the orientation and placement of each piece as described in the instructions.  In the course of the game, the players try to move all their pieces to the opposite side of the board with the first one doing so winning the game.  In a turn, one piece is moved one space or rotated 90° during each move.  When a piece from one player is moved adjacent to one of the other, an Overpowering Move occurs, where the piece having the higher number on the touching side allowing that player to push the opponent's piece one space in any direction.

—user summary

Name: Sagrada: Promo 9 – Man Vs Meeple Window Pattern Card
Description:
Promotional card offered by the "Man Vs Meeple Season 3 Kickstarter".

A new double sided player card to build the stained glass window in. Shuffle into the deck with the other player cards during setup and proceed as normal

This card features a level 3 and 6 pattern on opposing sides.

Name: Potato Kingdom Saga: Hot Crown
Description:
Times are tough in Potato Kingdom. Kings of the Tater realm are in the midst of a terrible uprising. The one true Crown now only brings cursed existence to its bearer whilst the starch is still spilled on the slightly acidic PH battlefields.

In Hot Kings up to 5 players are vying for control of the Potato Kingdom. The Crown deals damage to those who wear it, and as each player draws cards which can alter not only their own stature in the realm with a growing Keep of loyal subjects and siege weapons to defend and attack, but also control the Crown and use diplomacy and politics to overcome their opposing Kings.

Will you attempt to build a strong wall of Tater people and hope your adversaries destroy each other, or will you play the unpredictable manic King and warp the battlefield turn by turn in this frantic, push your luck game of potato elimination.

Games are quick and easy to learn, and fit into any family or friend gathering as a party game to see who is really on your side.

It's hot potato like you've never played!

—description from the designer

Name: The Colonisationing
Description:
We've harnessed the power to travel through space and visit other planets. We've started building small civilisations on them, and harvesting their sciences and resources. Oh, and we can all strap giant rockets to them and blast them into different galaxies.

It's up to you as the mogul of your star-colonising enterprise to build the most powerful star system humankind has ever seen. In The Colonisationing up to 4 players try and shift high scoring planets into their own system against each other's own huge rockets and strategic buildings to get their secret objectives completed.

You can increase the stats of planets by building huge structures on them to grant yourself bonuses. You want to be the next big science mojo? build labaratoriums. Do you want your planets to be the most habitable planets ever discovered and become huge tourist destinations? Go for it.

Be ever mindful though that at any point your nemesis space entrepreneurs can steal those planets right from under your nose by the power of Whopping Great Rockets™

The game features an unknown end game so players are always on their feet not knowing when the last turn will be, as well as hidden objectives to grant potentially game altering winners.

—description from the publisher

Name: Lorenzo il Magnifico: The Pazzi Conspiracy
Description:
This is for the standard edition of Lorenzo il Magnifico: The Pazzi Conspiracy which consists of 24 cards.

Lorenzo il Magnifico: The Pazzi Conspiracy Kickstarter Edition consists of 48 cards.


This edition is a 24-card expansion that enriches the original Lorenzo il Magnifico experience. You will move in the darkness and, for the first time, the cards you play will influence the actions of the other players. The ancient and dark streets of the city are the perfect environment to punish your opponents.

True kings are born in the slums!

The New Edition of Lorenzo il Magnifico already include this promo.

Name: Brain Warp: The Trivia Game
Description:
Place a deck of cards with questions taken from four categories (people and history, science and the world, miscellaneous, sports and entertainment) and a hexagonal score mat divided into six sections (including START) at the center. Each player/team choose a triangular mover and place it on the START space.

Oldest player draws a card from the deck and reads aloud the question on the front of the card to everybody, stating the three possible answers.

First person to clap their hands together gets to answer the question. The reader of the card decides all ties. If they are correct, that player or team moves their triangle ahead one space. The card is placed in a discard pile. If they are incorrect, the reader will indicate they are incorrect and any other player or team gets a chance to answer by immediately clapping their hands first. If nobody gets it, the card goes into the discard pile.

The player who answered the question correctly then draws and reads the next question. Play continues until a player or team has answered five questions correctly.

Includes score mat + 90 cards + 4 triangle movers. Play one-on-one or split players into up to four teams.

Name: Für die Katz
Description:
Für die Katz is the cooperative children’s game, in which animal voices make a path audible that cannot be seen.
Together the players bring cats from the forest back into their baskets. But in the forest it is dark. Blindfolded, one player always guides his walking stick through the impassable terrain. The other players guide it to where the cats have lost their way. Good listening is required: From which direction is the dog barking? Is a goat bleating? And where does the eagle owl point the way? All cats can be rescued and falling branches can be avoided by attentive cooperation.

—description from the publisher

Name: In the Shadows: Resistance in France 1943 - 1944
Description:
"In the Shadows" is a two-player card-driven wargame about the desperate struggle of the French Resistance against the occupying Nazi and collaborating French forces between January 1943 and June 1944. In the game you will play as either the Resistance or the Occupation in a fight over the hearts and minds of the French People. The game strives to have players better understand the nuances of the Resistance and the clandestine nature of the fight that led to the founding of the modern French Republic.

In the Shadows will also offer a narrative solitaire option where players can take on the role of a leader of the Resistance movement. These different playable characters will allow for diverse experiences against a challenging Occupation automata. Using the same mechanics as the two player game, the solo option is focused on a more immersive gaming experience. This makes "In the Shadows" unique in that players will essentially be able to enjoy two different wargames in the same box.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mosaic Quo
Description:
Mosaic Quo is a Mosaic set exclusively for four players. It's played the same as the base game, but it has four sets of distinctly colored pieces on the same 7x7 board.


     Starting with the first player, place your pieces one by one in the empty hole of the game board.
     If four pieces are lined up in the smallest square shape adjacent to each other, pieces can be placed on them.
     If four frames are arranged in a square, and three or four of the four are occupied by the same color, the frame of that color is automatically placed on it (apart from the turn).
     The piece fixed from the beginning to the center of the game board becomes a neutral piece which is not that of either player. When a square containing neutral frames is created, frames are automatically placed on top of the square only if the remaining three frames have the same color.
     Automatically placed pieces will create new squares, and if 3 or 4 of the squares are occupied with the same color, pieces will be placed automatically as well. In this way, pieces are stacked in a chain reaction. The pieces to be stacked may not only be the pieces of the active player, but also the pieces of the opposing player.
     In this way, the person who put the piece in turn alternately and who finished all his pieces first wins.


—description from publisher

Name: Mosaic Mini
Description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION

    
    
         The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Mosaic Mini is a non-authorized version of Upper Hand. 

    


Mosaic Mini has a 5x5 board and fewer pieces, but it is otherwise the same as the larger 7x7 edition Mosaic.

The game is functionally identical to Margalith Akavya's Upper Hand.

Name: The Presence
Description:
The Presence is a strategic horror-game that puts you in a victorian-era ghost story. Each game is either fully cooperative or one-versus-all, only you have no way of knowing which one..

The game is for 2-5 players where one player plays as a spirit with unknown intentions. The others play as the visitors, who need to work together to determine whether the spirit is on their side, while also trying to find out what it wants. The visitors will try to work together while struggling with darkness, isolation and the constant haunting of the spirit, who in turn either tries to earn their trust or secretly plan their demise.

A Game About Trust
Regardless of the intentions of the spirit-player the trust of the visitors is valuable to its goals. A benevolent spirit needs their trust to play its more powerful actions. If it does not believe that they will manage in time it can instead turn on them and win by other means. A vengeful spirit can bide its time, sabotaging their efforts in hidden ways and use their trust to make the visitors expose themselves. Then, when they are vulnerable it can reveal its true nature..

Game Mechanics
The visitors are represented on the board while the spirit moves through the house ethereally and can be in multiple locations at once. While visitors are limited by doors and passageways, the spirit can move freely, surrounding them.

While the spirit-player may have very limited means to communicate, the visitors have an even tougher choice to make. If they separate and go different ways they will not be able to speak at all. Then, they can only watch on in horror as their friend must make a perilous choice with no support.

The actions of the spirit leave clues as to its true intentions, and when the secrets of the house are gradually revealed the visitors may realize what they think they know is fatally wrong..

Name: Flip-it: Musical Thrones
Description:
It's time to decide who will be the next king. The Lion is ready to keep its position, but the Tiger, Panther and Puma are committed to take the crown for themselves. Be the fastest to meet the challenges, earn crowns tokens and become the King of the Forest!

Players reveal a random challenge token.

Someone press PLAY on the companion app and players start flipping through the pages of their flip-book viewing the animation. While the music is playing, keep flipping and making your character dance around the throne.

When the music stops be the fastest to complete the challenge. You must stop exactly on the page indicated by the challenge. There are two types of challenges:

Throne Challenge

    Stop on the page where your character sits on the throne


Animal Challenge

    Stop at one of the pages where the animal from the challenge token appears.


When a player gets 3 Crown Chips they are the winner and declared the King of Forest.

Includes variants to play with any music, solo mode, and much more!
