COMPONENTS:
04 Flip-books
03 Order tokens
12 Crown Tokens
12 Challenge Tokens
01 DJ Marker
Rules

-description from designer

Name: REMember
Description:
Welcome to the dream centre of the brain. You are a member of the REM team: your task is to enter the confusing world of dreams, find the memories hidden within, and move them to long term memory storage. You must develop your brain by storing as many memories as you can. But be careful: if you cause a nightmare whilst you’re in your dreams, then you’ll forget everything…

REMember is a push your luck game. Each night for one week you will enter your dreams, sort cards to match memories and move them to long term storage. You must store as many memories as possible over the course of the week. Whilst you’re in your dream you can prepare as many memories for storage as you want: but you can only move memories to long term storage once per night.
But be careful: the longer you stay in your dreams, the higher the chance you'll cause a nightmare, losing all the memories you have prepared.

—description from the designer

Name: Choose Happiness @ Work
Description:
Choose Happiness @ Work is a fun way to learn about the science of happiness and each other. Get your team talking, laughing and solving real-world workplace problems. Learn science-based strategies to use again and again, to boost happiness, increase productivity, and encourage a culture of collaboration and innovation.

Here's how it works:

     Players take turns being the Executive, who picks a common workplace problem.
     Others advocate for the best science-based solution from their hand, making informative, creative or humorous pitches.
     The Executive awards points for both the best solution and the most creative or funniest.

Name: Frog Party
Description:
Frog Party is a fun first addition game designed to support children learning to count up to ten. Players race their frogs to the top of their board to win and be the first to join their friends at the frog party!

How to play: Spin the double spinner to create two numbers to add together. Children can then use the lily pad counters to add the two numbers by counting, before they progress to the tried and tested number line method of basic addition. The higher the answer to your sum is, the further you can move your frog up your board! Reach the frog party first to win the game.

Each player has their own board in this fun frog-filled game, which develops both counting and addition skills. Both the cards and number lines feature quirky frog characters - from magician frogs to princess frogs - which children will enjoy!

Contents:
4 lily pad paths (3-piece jigged boards)
4 frog characters
4 character stands
10 lily pad discs
1 double spinner/number line
1 instruction leaflet

Name: We're Doomed!: Alternative Facts Promo Card
Description:
An event card.

Clandestine/Read Silently.

Text says:
This card does nothing.

At any time, instead of revealing this card, pretend to read it out loud, lying about what it says. Then place this card at the bottom of the deck without showing anyone.

If anyone catches you in this, lose 1 influence, but never acknowledge that this text blatantly contradicts you.

Keep this card face down until until you have come up with a good lie.

Originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Secret Societies
Description:
Secret Societies is a social deduction drafting game where player’s loyalties are not only hidden, but also ever-shifting in this quick and addicting game of adaptability.

This game features simultaneous play, fast and simple turns, and light social deduction elements that allow those players who get ‘caught’ to actually be at an advantage. Each turn brings 2 choices with a single action: which faction do you become committed to, but which faction do you help win. You can only be loyal to 1 faction by the end of the game, so you must adapt!

Secret Societies revolves around a single deck that includes different amounts of cards for each of the 3 factions competing for power: The Order, the Chaos faction, and the faction of Secrets. Each turn, players will draw 2 cards from the deck, choosing 1 to keep and 1 to display in front of them. The cards the players keep affect their loyalty based on the majority of symbols of each faction's type in hand. The cards they display not only give a little insight to what that player did not keep, but those displayed cards will also get reshuffled back into the deck at the end of a cycle. Once the deck is depleted, players will discuss and vote for a player that then must reveal cards from their hand. Some cards may get returned back to the deck this way. The currently displayed cards now get gathered into a new, smaller deck and a new cycle begins. After the second cycle and voting session, the displayed cards get gathered 1 final time, and players will complete 1 final draft, keeping 1 card that permanently solidifies their loyalty, and displaying 1 final card. Those final displayed cards determine the winner(s) of the game.

First, if any player ends the game loyal to Secrets, they win, along with anyone else who has Secret cards in their hand. This is not an easy feat, however, for how few Secret cards are in the deck.

Second, within the deck are Bribes, tempting those hungry enough to be willing to do anything to be the sole winner. If all Bribes have been taken, and no Bribe cards are displayed at the end of that final draft, the 1 player with the most Bribe cards in hand will win alone.

Third, The Order wishes to remain in power and they want to keep their Scrolls that are in the deck safe and out of player's hands, even if that means abusing their power to invade player's privacy. So, if there is at least 1 Scroll and at least 1 Order card displayed at the end of that final draft, all players loyal to The Order win.

Last, The Chaos faction wishes to overthrow The Order by stealing all the Scrolls from the deck. So if there are no Scroll cards or no Order cards displayed at the end of that final draft, then all players loyal to Chaos win.

-description from designer

Name: Fray: Into the Tassradan Trail
Description:
Journey into the Tassradan Trail is the first expansion for Fray (Smunchy Games). With it, we’re adding three new suits featuring new abilities that can damage and move units. We’re incredibly excited about movement in particular—which opens up new combos and opportunities at every stage in the game. The Tassradan Trail keeps the basic rules of Fray, but the way it’s played is wholly changed.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pays de Brocéliande: Le jeu !
Description:
Pays de Brocéliande: Le jeu ! is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the Pays de Brocéliande.

Each player places his pawn on his commune of residence or of his choice, from Bécherel to Plélan-le-Grand via Montauban-de-Bretagne, Montfort-sur-Meu, Saint-Méen-le-Grand or many more.
You will travel through the territory and have to answer questions on different themes. If the answer is correct you can replay.
To be the winner, you will have to collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.

Name: Paranormal Detectives: Man vs Meeple Promo Card
Description:
A new story card for the game.

Originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Finger Guns at High Noon: "Stinky" Pete Boone Promo Card
Description:
"Stinky" Pete Boone

Keeper.
When you gain this ally, give him to another survivor.

At the beginning of the round, if you have "Stinky" Pete Boone, lose 1 health.

The current owner of "Stinky" Pete Boone may target him with a SHOT action to give him to another survivor.

International Tabletop Day Promo and was available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Paris: La Cité de la Lumière – La Liberté éclairant le monde Carte Postale
Description:
Choose one of the four possible districts there is where the replica will be located. Mark your chosen quadrant by placing this postcard in the corner of the district.

At the end of the game, each player will receive 3 points for each of their buildings completely within the chosen district and 2 points for their buildings partially inside the district.

Originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Folklore: The Affliction – Dark Tales Expansion: Wanted Rumor Card
Description:
A new rumor card.

Note: You will need the Dark Tales expansion to use this card.

Originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Medium: Mind Control Promo Cards
Description:
A pack of 8 identical cards.

Text says:
Play two cards from your hand (your partner plays none), using them to attempt to match. Afterward, draw back up to six cards.

Originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Kraqua
Description:
An adventurous journey through the depths of the sea begins: in the cooperative family game Kraqua, players must bring the fish safely to the target and at the same time safely get their gems to the hiding place. But danger lurks in the depths of the ocean: the greedy octopus Kraqua has it in for the gems. Will the players manage to escape the thieving tentacles?

The special feature: Due to the foldable game plan changes, the running path becomes gradually visible. In addition, there are three different difficulty levels.

How to play:
Each player in turn places reef tiles on the game board to protect the fish. But the reef tiles have gaps. The players must skilfully move forward so that no fish is placed on a gap. Otherwise Kraqua will steal gems. Can the players hide all the gems in time?

Name: Kneipenquiz: Back to School
Description: Well - it's been a long time! This Kneipenquiz-expansion tests the knowledge from school days and puts general knowledge to the test even more. 250 brand-new questions can be combined with Kneipenquiz - Das Original and Fußball-Spezial.

Name: Black Stories: Poznanski
Description:
black stories - that stands for macabre puzzle stories, lots of black humor and a bit of creepiness. The black and red card sets have been among the bestsellers in the games sector for many years. Now the moses. Verlag has been able to win over bestselling author Ursula Poznanski for the black stories.

The 50 brand-new mysterious puzzles from the pen of Ursula Poznanski are a successful mixture of human abysses and humor - typical black stories. In her stories, the truth is multi-layered, man and machine collide with disastrous consequences, and seemingly harmless games turn into deadly danger. Each mystery is a whodunit, where questions, guessing and fiddling must be used to uncover the secret.

By the way, Poznanski's favorite puzzles from her own edition are "Ungeworfen" and "Das Letzte!"

iddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. A spooky card game just right for any party.

Name: Black Stories: Berlin
Description:
Why did Maurice shudder when he arrived at Ku'damm? Why were onlookers singing when Lennart was attacked by a polar bear in Friedrichshain? And why did Laura have a panic attack every time she looked through the windows of the Berlin subway? The "black stories Berlin" collect 50 pitch-black riddles around the cosmopolitan city on the Spree. From Pankow to Schöneberg and from Spandau to Köpenick: plenty of macabre stories and criminal cases about blackmailers and serial killers. Berlin from its darkest side ... suspense, fun and scurrility!

How to play:
The card set contains 50 tricky, pitch-black puzzle cards for teens and adults to solve by asking clever questions. Cracking black stories together with friends is the most fun. One player, the bidder, takes a card from the deck, reads the short story written on the front of the card. On the back of the card, the master finds the answer, which he of course keeps to himself. Now the guessing people have to "ask" themselves the solution to the story. The questions should be formulated in such a way that the master can answer "yes" or "no". A spooky and fun guessing game for small and large groups - can also be played digitally.

Name: Black Stories: True Crime
Description:
Whether it's a hammer murderer, a corpse in the freezer, or soap made from human remains, these eerie mystery stories are guaranteed not for the faint of heart. And the most hair-raising thing about it: They really and truly happened that way! In "black stories True Crime" 50 pitch-black riddles are gathered around real-life criminal cases. Macabre, unbelievable, scary - and 100% true!

How to play:
The card set contains 50 tricky, pitch-black puzzle cards for teens and adults to solve by asking clever questions. Cracking black stories together with friends is the most fun. One player, the bidder, takes a card from the deck, reads the short story written on the front of the card. On the back of the card, the master finds the answer, which he of course keeps to himself. Now the guessing people have to "ask" themselves the solution to the story. The questions should be formulated in such a way that the master can answer "yes" or "no". A spooky and fun guessing game for small and large groups - can also be played digitally.

Name: The Peace Treaty
Description:
The Peace Treaty is a two to five player area of control game where the goal is to achieve victory in a brutal civil war scenario. Begin the game fighting over the equally worthless lands of the Realm of Parabell, but vote on powerful bills that can completely change the value of strategic tiles on the map! Fight this war fair and square, or use covert operations and unorthodox tactics to gain the upper hand over your foes! You can also use diplomacy and trade to further your goals! Whatever playstyle you and your friends may choose, the Peace Treaty has it covered! But only one faction can win in the end!

The game takes 60 to 90 minutes. It can be played with 2-5 people. the game ends after 10 turns, or after 12 peace treaty bills have been drawn onto the table and 1 climax bill has been drawn onto the table.

Every turn players go though a number of phases. The First phase is the Allocate war budget phase where players will allow money to show how much they will spend on war this turn.

The Second phase is the peace treaty phase, where players will vote on bills that will change the value of tiles on the map and add or remove rules, players vote on bills by reaching their hand into a cotton bag, and at the same time drawing out coins to place on 1 of three sides.. Pass, Ban or Veto, Each side does a different thing depending on the card and the side with the most money gets put into play.

The third phase is the war phase, where players look at a list of actions which include, moving their armies, attacking other players, sending out airstrikes or even committing unethical actions~. Unethical actions are actions which in all senses are better than normal war actions but force the player to collect unethical cubes, which do nothing at the start of the game but may punish players harshly if certain cards have been put into play.

Lastly, is the income phase, where everyone collects income from owning land, 1 coin per 3 tiles + whatever card rulings after collecting income, players draw the next peace treaty card and do it all again until they reach the end of turn 10 where they will count up victory points and whoever has the most wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Ultimate Railroads
Description:
In Ultimate Railroads, players compete in an exciting race to build the largest and most advanced railway network. In order to do so, the players appoint their workers to various important tasks.

The development of simple tracks will quickly bring the players to important places, while the modernization of their railway network will improve the efficiency of their machinery. Newer locomotives cover greater distances and factories churn out improved technology. Engineers, when used effectively, can be the extra boost that an empire needs to race past the competition.

There are many paths to victory: Who will ride into the future full steam ahead and who will be run off the rails? Whose empire will overcome the challenges ahead and emerge victorious?

Ultimate Railroads includes the Russian Railroads base game and all expansions for the game — German Railroads and American Railroads, as well as the smaller promo items New Engineers, Juri Dreigleisky, and Manufactory Train — along with two new items: Asian Railroads and a solo variant.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: SaintCards: Doctors of the Church Expansion
Description:
SaintCards: Doctors of the Church Expansion adds 28 new cards to the SaintCards base game of  and completes the collection of all 36 Doctors proclaimed in the Latin Rite of the Catholic Church.

This expansion adds a fun twist with three new strategic choices: When you play a Doctor of the Church, you collect your Treasures as normal. You then may immediately take the top card from the deck and either keep it, give it to another player, or place the card back on tope of the deck.

Name: Sagrada: Promo 11 – Game Store 2020 Window Pattern Card
Description:
A new double sided player card to build the stained glass window in. Shuffle into the deck with the other player cards during setup and proceed as normal.

A 3 & 6 level difficulty card made available to Friendly Local Game Stores in late 2020.

Name: Shockwave
Description: Up to four players compete to shoot white marbles up plastic ramps into a central square compartment. The box has nine red marbles in the center in a 3x3 grid. This grid is surrounded by three spaces on each of the four sides (forming a 4x4 grid with pillars for the corner spaces to hold the top of the compartment) for each player to shoot their marbles into. The red marbles in the center function as a shock transmitter to push other player's marbles from their spaces. The first player to get all their three marbles into the spaces wins.

Name: Calimala: Конклав
Description: When contribuing resources to a church you can spend one extra cube to bribe a cardinal in Rome. When churches score during the game the player with most cardinals receives an extra point.

Name: Monopoly: Jura
Description:
The classic Monopoly with elements from the region of Jura, in Switzerland.

Bankrupt the other players and win.

Name: Winding Vines
Description:
A Simple yet strategic tile laying, pattern making competitive puzzle, for kids and adults alike. Be the first to arrange tiles in such a way that an unbroken line of your chosen color connects the outer tiles of the (three-by-three) grid. You will be placing, replacing, switching, rotating and blocking tiles during play. It is a puzzle to solve and a race to solve it first.

Gameplay

Players take turns placing tiles on an imaginary invisible grid of three by three (3x3) with the goal of connecting the lines on the tiles. You want to connect the lines of your color around the outer edge of this imaginary grid. And at the same time preventing your opponent from connecting theirs.

As you place a tile, if there are tiles on the table, you must place it adjacent to another tile, horizontally or vertically. As soon as there are three tiles in a row or column, this sets the outer limits. The end result should be a three-by-three square of tiles.

As you play, you could do other actions instead of placing a tile, like rotating a tile, switching place between two tiles or replacing a tile. In addition to these four actions (placing, replacing, rotating and switching) you may always lock a tile at the end of your turn. You do this by placing your player marker onto the tile in question.

The winner is the first to have an unbroken line of their color connecting all of the outer tiles of the grid.

-description from designer

Name: Trek 12: At Home – Semaine 2
Description:
Trek 12: At Home - Semaine 2 is an official print and play mini-expansion, offered by the publisher in December 2020 (during the confinement in France).

It consists in a new player board and new ways to score (only multi players mode).

IN SUMMARY: the way you choose your results and fill out your form has not changed. We will always have to make "rope paths" and "zones" (especially zones).
You will manage to go on a small sporting outing by combining races and avoiding the police. ?
Can you resist the temptation of having too many glasses?

Last but not least ... be more careful than ever, because being forced to put a value greater than 12 outside the scope would send you directly to Zonzon, synonymous with immediate elimination. And to lose the game without even counting the points.

Name: Trek 12: Xmas
Description:
Trek 12: Xmas is an official print and play mini-expansion, offered by the publisher in December 2020 (during the confinement in France).

It consists in a new player board and new ways to score.

Each chain represents a garland. The bonuses of each garland are noted above each Rope Trail and depend on the number of DIFFERENT colored balls in the Rope Trail. The more balls of different colors in your garlands, the more points you will score!

Zones represent gifts. Each Zone gives a bonus ONLY if that zone has NO balls. The bonus is then equal to the value of the Zone in question and is noted in the line below.

Finally, it's Christmas !! So no orphans ... each orphan space gives a 5 point penalty ...

The player or players (if simultaneous) who are the first to fill in the box just below the star get a 10 point bonus

Name: Just Add Dice: Roll & Fight
Description:
The tensions have boiled over at this televised baking competition after the trash talk went too far. Now it's time to put down the whisk and put up your dukes. No one insults your cinnamon rolls. No one!

2-4 players each grab their favorite set of seven standard role-playing dice (d4, d6, d8, d10, d10%, d12, d20) and start by rolling all of them. Those seven dice are their bakery crew, from which they will secretly pick one chef to throw a cinnamon roll (Roll) or throw a punch (Fight) each round.

Everybody reveals their choices, then the players who chose Roll get to pick one chef to be rerolled. But beware; chefs on Fight can get a bonus reroll if picked! The highest result wins and claims all of the round's chefs as points.

However, if everyone chose to Roll, each chef is rerolled once instead. Or if everyone chose to Fight, then the bravest and lowest result wins outright. After seven rounds of flying fists and pastries the bakery with the most points wins!

-description from designer

Name: Warlord: Saga of the Storm – 20th Anniversary
Description:
The legendary collectible card game of d20 combat, Warlord: Saga of the Storm had a long history with many players still active in tournaments and leagues to this day. Warlord is a long-time favorite of many at AEG, and we did not want to let the 20th anniversary of this classic game pass without a tribute.

In the days of the CCG, Warlord was unique in its "Challenge System", which allowed players to take on rare and powerful enemies at special events. The most coveted of these were the Medusan Lords, completely unique cards that represented the creators' own role-playing game characters. If you beat the odds and defeated one, you claimed it as your own.

Warlord: Saga of the Storm – 20th Anniversary is an expansion for Warlord that looks back at the origins of the Medusan Lords when they were simple warlords, which means that everyone can now build decks using these characters! Items related to each character are included, along with a new challenge Overlord and a new alternate-art version of Brine Fiend!

—description from the publisher

Name: Draw or Swipe
Description:
In this fast moving 2-4 player tile game you compete to complete large triangular 'frames' using four smaller triangular tiles to score.

Each triangular tile has a number in each corner (1, 2 or 3). The corners of the four tiles must match each other when they go into the large frame.

A players turn consists of two parts: completing frame(s) and scoring.

To complete their frames, a player either 'draws' two facedown tiles from the tilepile or 'swipes' one faceup tile from another players uncompleted frames. A swiped tile gets a 'swipe token' put on it to keep it from being swiped by another player. Each player only has two swipe tokens to work with, so be judicious on the swiping.

Scoring is done once a frame has all four tiles placed in it. That makes it 'complete', and the tiles become un-swipe-able. The player moves their completed frame to the center of the table to corner match with other frames already in the center. The numbers in the center of the matched edge do not need to match, but there is a bonus if they do. Once a frame is moved to the center, any swipe pawns are retrieved by the player to be used again later.

The game is over at the end of the turn when the tilepile is emptied. Each player subtracts one point for every tile infront of them in uncompleted frames. High score wins.

Strategy hints:
Generally it is better to draw than swipe unless you are completing a frame.

If you are way ahead on points, it is better to draw down the tilepile to bring the game to an end.

Frames are scored on the corner numbers, so when possible put your higher numbers in the corner of the frame.

Always be building your frames with an eye on the frames in the center of the table. It does you no good to complete a frame if there is no place to put it and score.

There are six of each of the eleven unique tiles. Towards the end of the game you can look around to see whether the tile you really need is still in the tilepile, or whether you need to swipe it from another player.

-description from designer

Name: El Fantasma Travieso
Description:
El fantasma travieso is a fabulous game of association and visual deduction, where the ghost Crispin challenges you to discover the traps in the images captured on the cards, you have to be faster than your opponents to obtain the correct object and overcome the challenge of El Fantasma travieso.

Each card in the deck shows pictures of two objects, with one or both objects colored the wrong way. With all players playing at the same time, someone reveals a card, then players grab for the "right" object – but which object is right?

If one object is colored correctly, then players need to grab that correctly colored object.
If both objects are colored incorrectly, players need to grab the totally opposite one.

The first player to grab the correct object keeps the card, then reveals the next card from the deck. Once the card deck runs out, the game ends and whoever has collected the most cards wins!

Contents: 60 cards, 5 plastic figures
(White ghost, red truck, whirligig blue, gray soldier, green tree).

Name: Pocket Quiz: Unnützes Wissen
Description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with mental exercises. The backside of each card contains the solutions. Solve the exercises first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

This edition contains 150 questions about bizarre facts that are as useless as they are entertaining.

The title translates to "Useless Knowledge".

Name: Pocket Quiz: 1-Million-€-Fragen
Description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with mental exercises. The backside of each card contains the solutions. Solve the exercises first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

This edition contains 150 questions that are perfect for training for the final questions on quiz shows: Anyone who can solve these particularly challenging quiz questions is definitely ready to win millions!

The title translates to "1-million-€-questions".

Name: Black Stories Junior: Detective Stories
Description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: Detective Stories are exciting and tricky riddles for clever detectives. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

Name: Black Stories Junior: True Stories
Description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: True Stories are exciting and true stories full of secrets and riddles. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

Name: Tac-Tik
Description:
Tac-Tik is a board game similar to Pachisi or Tock. It is most popular in France.

Players have to race their four wooden pawns around the game board to be the first to finish getting them all home. Movement of the pawns is determined by dealt cards instead of by dice. Each turn, players can play a card, and the value of this card determines how can they move their pawns. Some cards have special effects (1 or 10 can be used to place a new pawn into play).

Name: Frantic: Pandora's Box
Description:
More Chaos: modify the rules of Frantic with the new Rule Cards, expand the game with the new colour purple, add more Troublemaker and Counterattack cards and make up your own effect for a new Event and a new Special Card.

With Pandora’s Box you get a box that can hold Frantic and all its add-ons as well. And for more order in your head there’s a new completely reworked rule book and overview cards. For beginners and forgetful minds.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Meeples
Description:
You did it, you finally got command of your very own starship. Sure it’s not one of the new hyper-advanced shiny ships, and yes your crew is mostly new recruits straight out of the academy, but it’s all yours!

In Star Meeples you compete against the other players to become the best captain and score the most points at the end of 6 rounds.

The core of Star Meeples is the Crew Queue, that’s a twist on traditional deck/bag building games. You can always see all the meeples in your queue, all neatly arranged in a vertical line.

—description from the designer

Name: Clearing
Description:
In “Clearing”, you play face-up face cards, your characters, next to each other while using the number cards in your hand, your resources, to remove the enemy cards that try to surround them. If your continuous group of face cards, your crew, is completely surrounded by enemy cards, the game ends in a loss. After the entire deck is drawn and the final enemy cards are placed, if your crew is not completely surrounded, you win. To succeed in “Clearing”, you’ll need to strategically extend your crew with additional characters while using your resources to keep them from being overwhelmed.

-description from designer

Name: Nemesis: Lockdown – Dice Tower 2021 Promo Cards
Description:
Set of 5 completely new Achievements for your adventures in Nemesis: Lockdown. Those mini-quests will help you achieve your objective, allow you to survive, or derail your opponents' plans. The choice is yours!

Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Mission:Maya
Description:
The plane crash of the notorious archaeologist Dr. Hanz, alongside all of his research, has been discovered. Your mission: retrace his steps to uncover what happened to the sacred Idol of Kapookan. Explore the surrounding areas and venture through the caves of Mount Kap to uncover all the secrets, mysteries, and solve the many puzzles left behind by the ancient Mayan people.

Using the items found in the Mission: Maya game box, you'll need to solve all the puzzles you come across during your journey. Every card you flip will be a new area to discover, a new item to decipher, or perhaps a trap that ends up wasting your precious time. Solve all the puzzles and challenges to unlock the Lockbox and discover the Mystery inside.

When you find a secret code or have the solution to a puzzle, you can enter it into the Code Input on the Game Page. If you get the correct answer, a message will pop up with further instructions.

Components:
70 Illustrated Playing Cards
Dr. Hanz's Notebook
Dr. Hanz's Business Card
Polaroid
Envelope with 24 Puzzle Pieces
Burlap Pouch
8 Coloured Stones
6 Shattered Pieces
5 Mayan Coins
Scroll
Locked Box
Mystery Item

Name: Big Bang Burgers
Description:
A highly strategic card came version of a food fight. Players take turns drawing cards and building burgers to earn money, the game ends once all the burgers have been finished. While you place delicious ingredients on your burgers your opponents will place ingredients like a cockroach or a severed finger!

Players may block opponents moves, steal ingredients, or even a whole burger. Gain a 5-star review and beware the health inspector or dreaded Bang Card.

Each Player is randomly dealt Bun Heel Cards that remain face up in front them. Then, Players are Dealt a 5 card hand. Each turn, players add Green (tasty) Ingredients to their own burger, Red (gross) Ingredients to another player's burger, or play a Blue Action Card to steal ingredients from another player. Once a Bun Crown is played, no more ingredients can be added or taken away. When all burgers are done, and the points listed on each of the ingredients cards and the player with the highest score wins!

Name: The Next Thing
Description:
Who doesn't like cloud spotting?

In THE NEXT THING, playing stones represent clouds. Players take turns adding them to the board, and try to match the resulting combination to one of the displayed patterns.

As a player realizes that one of the patterns is going to be matched soon, they can bet on it. When a pattern is completed, the bets are revealed and those who predicted it first get a reward.

The game is over when all 7 stones from the prize pile have been taken or when one of the players runs out of stones. The player with the greatest number of stones wins the game.

In THE NEXT THING you will need to use both your social and pattern recognition skills to guess what other players are betting on, and your wits to outsmart them.

It is a fun, fast-paced game with a very simple rule set yet surprisingly complex strategies, suitable for both kids and adults.

-description from designer

Name: Die Reise nach Jerusalem!
Description: The players start their journey on 4 different locations. Movement is determined by a die. The players have three tries to roll the number indicated on the next space to advance to this space. If a player rolls a 1 he may not move at all, all other players may advance 1 step. The first player to reach Jerusalem wins the game.

Name: Cover Your Asps
Description:
In Cover Your Asps, players navigate the newly discovered Egyptian temple of Ombi Quadi to collect the treasures hidden within its inner chamber.

Cobra-like snakes called asps are the guardians of the temple. Asps are ready to attack from myriad snake pits. These pits are surrounded by quicksand, which is impenetrable by foot.

Use planks to build platforms to cover the quicksand and pits and get to the inner chamber. Navigate your pathways around granite slabs that raise and lower to block your path.

Reach the center of the temple and escape with a valuable treasure, but beware of the scorpion which your opponent will unleash. Play in rounds until all treasures have been recovered. Each round has three phases:
Build, Collect, Escape.

Four antechambers allow up to four players to compete against each other.

Configurable game board for a variety of challenge levels.

—description from the publisher

Name: You Said You Could Draw
Description:
Put your skills under a blindfold with a whole new spin on the   drawing game: You Said You Could Draw! everybody knows that one person who can draw anything, this game levels the playing field.

HOW TO PLAY
IT”S SIMPLE AS 1-2-3-4
1. ROLL - The artist takes the big drawing board and blindfold and takes the first card, rolls the dice to see what word he secretly has to draw.
 2. DRAW - Once the artists feels he is ready, he reveals the drawing to everyone. Based on what level you are playing, clues are given if applicable. You can’t use numbers, symbols or letters in your drawings. If there are questions in the group about answers take a vote.

3. GUESS - Once the artists feels he is ready, he secretly writes a player’s name, who he feels will guess correctly for a bonus. The artist then reveals the drawing to everyone. Based on what level you are playing, clues are given if applicable. The other players secretly write on their boards what the artist drew. After everyone has made their guess, one by one, everyone reveals their guess and the artist reveals the answer. The artists then reveals his guess on the player who guessed correctly. Points are awarded on the main board accordingly.

4. SCORE 
1 Point-For the artist if at least one player guesses correctly.                                           
1 Point-Bonus For the artist if secretly selects the player who guesses correctly.           
1 Point-For all players who guess the correct answer.                                                      
3 Points(The star mark word)-The artist and all players who guess correctly                
2 Points-If all players guess correctly except for one player, that player subtracts 2 points from their score.

The objective of the game is be the person to score 20 points.

-description from designer

Name: Buru: Ambelau
Description:
The Ambelau expansion adds seven discrete modules to expand and deepen your games of Buru, including a new board/region, multiple mini-expansions, and the option for a fifth player.  These modules may be used individually or in any combination.

Included in this expansion are:

- Fifth Player Module: All the components required to add a fifth player to the game.

- Ukum Module: The spirit Ukum represents justice and order in Buru. Players pay tribute to Ukum by exiling those who violate the natural law — especially Outcasts, a new type of Islander.

- Ambelau Module: The lush volcanic island of Ambelau is just a short trip from Buru. Players may send Explorers to this new region in canoes, where new action spaces await. Ambelau actions let you collect resources, gather fish, recruit Guides, and pay tribute to Ibu, the spirit of growth and life.

- Lawan Module: Solo options are included for everything in this expansion.

-Tokoh Module: Introduce leaders to your expeditions with asymmetrical starting positions and exclusive special actions for each player that may be taken in lieu of region actions.

-Blessings Module:  Seeking a strong bond with the newcomers, the inhabitants of the island offer support to those most in need - specifically, those with the lowest bid in each region.

-Liaisons Module: The Majapahit King sends a special diplomat with each party, offering a chance at a second action in the same region - but only if the Liaisons don't undermine each other's efforts!

Name: Самара Монополия
Description:
Ð¡Ð°Ð¼Ð°Ñ€Ð° ÐœÐ¾Ð½Ð¾Ð¿Ð¾Ð»Ð¸Ñ, Monopoly Samara is a local version of Monopoly set in the city of Samara. 
Players acquire cultural, industrial, entertainment and sports facilities and raise rents through upgrades. 
Own the Progress RKC, the Zhigulevsky brewery, the Rossiya confectionery, the Skat shopping and entertainment center and even the Kirovsky market. 
It includes 60 bonus and penalty cards (lottery, bank, authorities) ironically reflecting the city explicit and hidden economic processes.
Try not to go bankrupt while fixing all the roads!

Name: Господин Великий Новгород
Description:
Ð“Ð¾ÑÐ¿Ð¾Ð´Ð¸Ð½ Ð’ÐµÐ»Ð¸ÐºÐ¸Ð¹ ÐÐ¾Ð²Ð³Ð¾Ñ€Ð¾Ð´ ("Lord Novgorod the Great") is a Russian strategy games set during the times of the Novgorod Republic.

Each player becomes the head of a noble boyar family.

You can win in different ways: 

     get the highest elective position, mayor, and remain mayor for one turn;
     become the most honorable boyar, or 
     win the most battles !

Name: Universal Elements
Description:
In Universal Elements, two or more players race against each other to forge our solar system by combining the five basic elements (Water, Air, Fire, Earth, and Dark). The first player(s) to forge all celestial bodies on a Star Map wins.

After each round of forging, players are affected by a new Chaos card.  There's no telling what's out there! Often helping players that are behind, these Chaos cards keep the game interesting for beginners and experienced players alike.

This game is good for sharpening memory and dynamic math skills.  The space theme is consistent throughout, and conveys a wealth of space knowledge through play.

—description from the publisher

Name: New Year Eve Dinner
Description:
On the eve of the Chinese New Year, everyone will return to their parents' home for a reunion dinner. The New Year's Eve dinner represents family reunion, peace and good wishes.
In the board game "New Year Eve Dinner", you play the role of the "little host", trade other players' relative cards by memorizing theirs positions to invite as many relatives as possible to your seats. When all the dishes are served, whoever has the most relatives will win the game. The game challenges players' concertation and memory, and it also requires some of luck of cause. Come on, make a great New Year's Eve Dinner!
New Year Eve Dinner is a board game that combines Chinese New Year traditions, family constructions and typical dishes, and is suitable for family gatherings.
The game gives an experience of Chinese New Year vibe, and it is easy and fun to play for kids to elderlies, and also your friends.

Name: Astromino: To Catch a Star
Description:
A long time ago, many shooting stars fell to earth.  Most of them fell upon a hill.  It was eventually named the "Starry Hill". The faithful built places of worship upon this hill and gathered the falling stone gems.  In present time you try to gather the gems also to collect resources and build your buildings.  The person that is the most successful wins.

On your turn:
You will have 1 dice, then you predict the color and number of the next dice you will draw from the bag.  Then assign your worker on the board. After drawing the die add the 2 numbers together if your prediction is accurate you will gain extra resources.

The game uses number prediction statistics, as well as worker placement.

Name: Iron Helm: Uln-Rolk Promo Card
Description:
Character promo card for Iron Helm that came in the game box for StoneFire, from the same publisher. It is also available in a promo pack called the Gnome Pack #1, from Grey Gnome Games on the Game Crafter.

Card name: Uln-Rolk
Trappings: Mace
Skill: Divinity
Skill proficiency: Brawn

Name: StoneFire: Dodo Bird Promo Card
Description:
Promo card for StoneFire that came in the game box for Iron Helm, from the same publisher. It is also available in a promo pack called the Gnome Pack #1, from Grey Gnome Games on the Game Crafter.

Card name: DODO BIRD
Card text: "If the Dodo Bird is in your village at the end the of game [sic!], you gain 1vp for every 2 egg cards remaining in the egg deck."

Name: Mosaic
Description:
IntroductionMosaic is a territory game played on an initially empty hex board. Two players, Red and Blue, share a set of tiles, red on one side and blue on the other.

				
				
					Place or flip tiles, but not bothPlayers take turns placing or flipping tiles starting with Red. You either place one tile with your color showing or you flip one or more enemy tiles to your color. You never both add and flip tiles in one turn. If you have a placement or flip available you must do one of them. Otherwise you must pass until you do have a move.

				
				
					Tile placementYou can place a tile adjacent to an enemy tile or adjacent to nothing. You must never place a tile adjacent only to your own tiles. You must never place a tile that reduces your number of groups.

				
				
					Tile flippingFlipping a tile must accomplish two things. It must decrease your number of groups and decrease the total number of groups - yours plus your opponent’s. Flipping is not mandatory, unless part of a multiple flip sequence (see below).

				
				
					Multiple flip sequenceWhen you flip a tile, and while it’s still your turn, you may be required to flip additional tiles. If it’s possible to flip any tiles subject to the preceding section, "Tile flipping", which are adjacent to a tile flipped earlier in the same turn then you must flip one of them. If it’s still possible to flip more tiles adjacent to tiles flipped earlier in the same turn, you must flip another one, and so on. Your turn concludes when no more tiles adjacent to currently flipped tiles can be flipped. Tiles can be flipped in any order in a multi flip sequence. Which tiles get flipped in a multi flip sequence is not necessarily predetermined. Sometimes a player has a choice.

				
				
					Object of the gameThe game concludes when there are no more legal moves available. NOTE: Tiles can still be flipped after the board has filled up. The object is to have the most tiles on the board when the game ends.

Name: Neón y Acero
Description:
A board game for up to 5 players set in a dark future which the first player to collect 6 Spheres of energy wins. Players can choose their hero, get support, fulfill secret objectives, make a deal with other players -or betray them-, explore in search of Spheres, fight and truncate the moves of your rivals.

Players can share Deck in Free Play, create two different Decks in Theme Mode, or choose their favorite cards to build a custom Deck in Tournament Mode.

How to get Spheres?
- Fulfilling secret Objectives.
- Finding them while Exploring.
- Stealing from other players.
- Defeating 6 enemies.

On their turn, each player can:
- Stand up their cards.
- Play a Character from their hand.
- Explore or Attack with each Character.
- Draw cards until have 6.

Anytime:
- Play Action cards.
- Play an accomplished Objective card.
- Activate effects of any Character.
- Propose a Pact to another player.

The first player to collect 6 Spheres is the winner. There are different ways to get them, so keep an eye on the other players and guess their intentions!

-description from publisher

Name: American Pandemic: The Party Card Game
Description:
American Pandemic is a hilarious party card game of survival when ordinary U.S. citizens face too much free time during quarantine.

Play as American neighbors competing for the most bad luck as a pandemic suddenly sends everyone into lockdown when the U.S. declares a national state of emergency.

Players must hoard and steal stereotypical American essentials from each other, overcome the endless awkward quarantine scenarios created from 2020 memes, and stop the impending world disasters by using the rarest, most valuable commodity of the pandemic… Toilet Paper.

Just like Americans competing over the worst 2020 story, players compete for bad luck points. Every round a Headline card is revealed as a new crisis strikes the American public. Each headline builds on the last - creating more and more bad luck for everyone. The only way to stop them… toilet paper, of course. Player turns are comprised of three phases: Escape, Hoard, and Quarantine.

Players begin their turns by drawing from the Escape Draw Pile to “escape” the active Headline cards. 
Players next must hoard as much as they can by drawing from the Hoard Draw Pile. Hoard cards include all the stereotypical American essentials needed to survive like toilet paper, frozen dinners, cbd gummies, essential oils, coffee, chocolate, wine, gloves, tv, computers, puppies, guns, masks, and much more.  Finally, players end their turn as they are forced into quarantine by drawing from the Quarantine Draw Pile. Inspired by the countless 2020 memes, players read out-loud the embarrassing and awkward scenarios while their opponents enjoy a good laugh at their expense.

Throughout the game, bad Luck is stored in a player’s Crazy Stash or Sick Stash. The Crazy Stash represents a player’s declining mental state while the Sick stash represents their failing health. The player with the most bad luck points at the end of the game wins.

-description from designer

Name: Marvel Spider-Web
Description:
In Spider-Web, you and your teammates compete with the opposing team to see who can capture the most characters from the gallery of Spider-Man villains and allies.

The game is divided into 16 rounds, in which players draw cards on the table. In general, the fastest character in the round captures everyone else, scoring points for the team that put him into play. But most cards have special powers and winning conditions that create interesting situations and require planning and cooperation from the members of each team.

Name: Koala Bounce
Description:
Pick Red? A 5? A Hexagon? Then find a branch to sit upon. You might get bounced and lose a card. But you'll bounce back! It isn't hard!  To win, collect the cards you need; hang in there!  You may succeed!

In Koala Bounce players collect cards showing colors, numbers, and shapes. On their turn, players draw a card from the deck and move their Koala to any spot on the tree that matches the attribute on their drawn card. If they move to a branch that already contains another player's Koala, they may take any card from that player and that player's Koala gets "bounced" to the branch below.  The first player to collect a certain number of cards in any one of the three categories (color, numbers, or shapes) is the winner!

Name: Nidavellir: Jarika The Rogue Promo Card
Description:
Jarika The Rogue is a promo card to add to your deck of Hero Cards
It was first published in French in MaGRRREzine #3 (April 2020), then in the German and English versions of Spielbox 7/2020.
It was later included in the Thingvellir expansion released April 2021.


This Dwarf Countess, ruling the distant deserts, took longer than expected to reach the Kingdom. A highly respected aristocrat, Jarika owes her nickname to her talents as a speaker and a merchant, which has enabled her to significantly increase the wealth of her county. Some even say she might have greater wealth than Grid and Astrid combined! Anyway, if you start talking exchange and trade with her, she will always find a way to come out on top!
As in negotiation, her power will increase in strength as the game goes, allowing you to gain a large fortune and recruit the best Dwarfs!


She adds 8 points to your Final Bravery Value.
As a neutral Hero, place her in your Command Area.
During a coin transformation or a coin trade (Royal Offering, Warrior Distinction, Grid), increase the value of the desired sum by 2.

Name: Господин Великого Новгорода
Description:
Ð“Ð¾ÑÐ¿Ð¾Ð´Ð¸Ð½ Ð’ÐµÐ»Ð¸ÐºÐ¾Ð³Ð¾ ÐÐ¾Ð²Ð³Ð¾Ñ€Ð¾Ð´Ð° ("Lord Veliky Novgorod"), is a monopoly-type board game played on a map of Veliky Novgorod, divided into the main areas of the cities, with local businesses.

The goal of the game is to purchase land, then build and finally earn money from the rent.

The winner is the player who avoids bankruptcy.
